title: Biohacking — Evidence-based tools to feel sharper and stronger
description:
Transform your understanding of human performance from guesswork to science. This comprehensive biohacking course takes you on a journey through evidence-based strategies to optimize cognitive performance and physical vitality—guided by world-leading researchers from Stanford, Harvard, USC, and top research institutions worldwide. You'll learn from neuroscientists, physicians, exercise physiologists, and longevity researchers who have dedicated their careers to understanding how specific interventions can measurably enhance mental clarity, physical strength, and overall performance. From foundational practices like sleep optimization and strategic supplementation to cutting-edge protocols involving NAD+ enhancement, hormone optimization, and continuous glucose monitoring, this course cuts through the hype to deliver what actually works.

You'll learn from an exceptional panel of 17 credentialed experts including Dr. Andrew Huberman (Stanford Professor of Neurobiology and host of Huberman Lab), Dr. Rhonda Patrick (PhD biomedical scientist and founder of FoundMyFitness), Dr. David Sinclair (Harvard Professor of Genetics and pioneering aging researcher), Dr. Valter Longo (Director of USC Longevity Institute and pioneer of fasting-mimicking diet research), Dr. Andy Galpin (Professor of Kinesiology with 100+ peer-reviewed publications working with Olympic athletes and Special Forces), and many more accomplished scientists and physicians. These aren't self-proclaimed biohackers—they're researchers publishing in Nature, Science, and Cell, professors running university laboratories, and clinicians with decades of experience translating research into practical protocols.

The course is carefully structured to build your knowledge progressively. You'll start with accessible foundations: sleep optimization fundamentals, understanding dopamine for motivation and focus, foundational supplements with strong evidence bases (vitamin D, omega-3s), continuous glucose monitoring basics, red light therapy origins, and practical intermittent fasting protocols. Then you'll advance to understanding mechanisms: how vigorous exercise produces unique brain benefits, the science of building strength and muscle, fasting protocols for longevity and disease prevention, and medical approaches to hormone optimization. Finally, you'll explore the cutting edge: David Sinclair on NAD+ and the informational theory of aging, PhD researchers debating fasting controversies, advanced exercise physiology with elite performance protocols, neuroethical perspectives on cognitive enhancement, testosterone optimization strategies, and evidence-based sauna protocols for cardiovascular health and performance.

What makes this course trustworthy is the rigorous expert curation—every episode features a credentialed expert being interviewed (17 of 18 episodes feature PhDs or MDs), spanning approximately 16 different podcasts for maximum diversity of perspectives. No pseudoscience, no wellness influencers without credentials, no spiritual interpretations of biology—just evidence-based tools explained by the scientists and physicians who research and apply them. You'll finish this course not just knowing what biohacks to try, but understanding why they work at the cellular, neurological, and metabolic level—empowered with knowledge from the researchers who are literally pushing the frontiers of human performance optimization.
